results.title: Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia
results.text_hl: Two routine therapies used in @DISEASE_Cardiovascular_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D002318 @@@cardiovascular disease@@@ have been shown to significantly increase angiogenesis in preclinical models of @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@ and could be rapidly adopted for use in @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@. @CHEMICAL_Metformin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@, a widely used antidiabetic drug for @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@type 2 diabetes@@@, and @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a 3-hydroxy-3-methyl-glutaryl-CoA (HMG-CoA) reductase inhibitor, used to regulate @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ levels, have previously been shown to enhance recovery from @DISEASE_Acute_Disease @DISEASE_MESH:D000208 @@@acute@@@ @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@limb ischemia@@@ in nondiabetic animals, and pretreatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ has been shown to ameliorate @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@limb ischemia@@@ in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@.

citations.NLM: Goggi JL, Haslop A, Boominathan R, Chan K, Soh V, Cheng P, Robins EG, Bhakoo KK. Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia Contrast Media Mol Imaging. 2019;2019():2538909. PMID: 30863219
citations.BibTeX: @article{30863219, title={Imaging the Proangiogenic Effects of Cardiovascular Drugs in a Diabetic Model of Limb Ischemia}, author={Goggi JL and Haslop A and Boominathan R and Chan K and Soh V and Cheng P and Robins EG and Bhakoo KK}, journal={Contrast Media Mol Imaging}, volume={2019}, pages={2538909}}

results.title: High-dose atorvastatin is superior to moderate-dose simvastatin in preventing peripheral arterial disease.
authors: Incremental Decrease in End Points Through Aggressive Lipid Lowering Study Group
results.text_hl: High-dose @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ is superior to moderate-dose @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ in preventing @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral arterial disease@@@.

results.title: Low-density lipoprotein lowering does not improve calf muscle perfusion, energetics, or exercise performance in peripheral arterial disease.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Sixty-eight @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with mild to moderate symptomatic @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@ (age 65 +- 11 years; ankle-brachial index [ABI] 0.69 +- 0.14) were studied at baseline and annually for 2 years after beginning @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg (n = 20) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg/@CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ 10 mg (n = 18) if statin naive, or @CHEMICAL_Ezetimibe @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069438 @@@ezetimibe@@@ 10 mg (n = 30) if taking a statin.

citations.NLM: West AM, Anderson JD, Epstein FH, Meyer CH, Wang H, Hagspiel KD, Berr SS, Harthun NL, Weltman AL, Dimaria JM, Hunter JR, Christopher JM, Kramer CM. Low-density lipoprotein lowering does not improve calf muscle perfusion, energetics, or exercise performance in peripheral arterial disease. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2011 Aug 30;58(10):1068-76. PMID: 21867844
citations.BibTeX: @article{21867844, title={Low-density lipoprotein lowering does not improve calf muscle perfusion, energetics, or exercise performance in peripheral arterial disease.}, author={West AM and Anderson JD and Epstein FH and Meyer CH and Wang H and Hagspiel KD and Berr SS and Harthun NL and Weltman AL and Dimaria JM and Hunter JR and Christopher JM and Kramer CM}, journal={J Am Coll Cardiol}, volume={58}, number={10}, pages={1068-76}}

results.title: Lymphocyte-suppressing action of simvastatin in patients with isolated hypertriglyceridemia.
results.text_hl: METHODS: The study included 46 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with elevated @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglyceride@@@ levels and @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral artery stenosis@@@, randomly assigned to receive @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or placebo.

results.title: Effect of simvastatin on hemostasis in patients with isolated hypertriglyceridemia.
results.text_hl: METHODS: The study included 39 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with elevated @CHEMICAL_Triglycerides @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014280 @@@triglyceride@@@ levels and @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral artery sclerosis@@@, treated for 90 days with either @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg daily) or placebo.

results.title: Monocyte-suppressing effects of simvastatin in patients with isolated hypertriglyceridemia.
results.text_hl: METHODS: Our study included 43 subjects with isolated @DISEASE_Hypertriglyceridemia @DISEASE_MESH:D015228 @@@hypertriglyceridemia@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral artery stenosis@@@ randomly allocated to one of two groups, treated for 12 weeks with either @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ (40 mg twice daily) or placebo.

citations.NLM: Krysiak R, Okopien B. Monocyte-suppressing effects of simvastatin in patients with isolated hypertriglyceridemia. Eur J Intern Med. 2013 Apr;24(3):255-9. PMID: 23159435

results.title: Lipid-lowering for peripheral arterial disease of the lower limb.
results.text_hl: It may also reduce cardiovascular events and/or local disease progression in people with lower limb @<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@peripheral arterial disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Peripheral_Arterial_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058729 @@@PAD@@@).
